tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE EnergyDistribution (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(50),
    day_of_week VARCHAR(10),
    time_slot TIME,
    energy_demand FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyConsumption (
  consumer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  consumption DECIMAL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyProduction (
  production_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  producer_id UUID,
  production_amount DECIMAL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyDistribution (
  distribution_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  distribution_center_id UUID,
  consumer_id UUID,
  distribution_amount DECIMAL,
  cost DECIMAL,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyDistribution (
   distribution_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   provider_id INT,
   consumer_id INT,
   distribution_date DATE,
   energy_amount DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyProviders (
    provider_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    provider_name VARCHAR(255),
    region VARCHAR(100),
    energy_source VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyConsumers (
    consumer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    consumer_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    energy_demand FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyTransactions (
    transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    provider_id INT,
    consumer_id INT,
    energy_amount FLOAT,
    transaction_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyPrices (
    price_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    energy_type VARCHAR(100),
    price_per_unit FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE EnergyGrid (
    grid_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    grid_name VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    capacity FLOAT
)
